alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Chouteau; Hill (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 07 at 1:23PM MDT until June 07 at 4:30PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: The National Weather Service in Great Falls has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Blaine County in north central Montana... Northeastern Chouteau County in north central Montana... Southeastern Hill County in north central Montana... * Until 430 PM MDT. * At 123 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is imminent. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Parker School, Agency, St. Pierre, Sangrey and Rocky Boy. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
